channel.title: How to add the command ::max for players?
channel.description:
Our server is kind of a pking server, i want to know how to get for them to do ::max
Just to level them to 126! To pk, not go train. Please help to anyone, tell me what command to add in what place! Thanks to whoever can help!
! ! ! ! !

item.title: How to add the command ::max for players?
item.dc:creator: @David-mod_of_lordsca David-mod_of_lordscape
item.description:
@David-mod_of_lordsca wrote:

[quote=“arham 4, post:22, topic:434346”][quote author=PureQuintinScape link=topic=537067.msg3927716#msg3927716 date=1330386184]
Thanks david, but one more problem, the command doesn’t work in-game after i added it, etc

Need someone to teamview me, will rep++!!!
[/quote]
David, nice one! Haha. Mate, first, let me tell you something.
/**/ or // comments code. He commented the whole thing, making the command not read by compile.bat. Delete the /* and */.
After that, read this.

Also, you can’t rep :P.

Change ,

To

You didn’t know about comments where you’re telling him this?[/quote]

My command works fine i don’t see why you went threw all this trouble to try to state a point. i did my part to help this user. This isn’t a spoon feeding community like many experienced users have stated. So please if you have your methods of coding then so be it im going to do my part and help out users that need it.

Read full topic
item.source: How to add the command ::max for players?

[quote=“PureQuintinScape, post:20, topic:434346”]Thanks david, but one more problem, the command doesn’t work in-game after i added it, etc

Need someone to teamview me, will rep++!!![/quote]
David, nice one! Haha. Mate, first, let me tell you something.
/**/ or // comments code. He commented the whole thing, making the command not read by compile.bat. Delete the /* and */.
After that, read this.

Also, you can’t rep :P.

[quote=“David-mod_of_lordscape, post:21, topic:434346”]Change ,

To

You didn’t know about comments where you’re telling him this?

item.source: How to add the command ::max for players?

item.title: How to add the command ::max for players?
item.dc:creator: @David-mod_of_lordsca David-mod_of_lordscape
item.description:
@David-mod_of_lordsca wrote:

This isn’t a spoon feeding community but here.

if (playerCommand.startsWith("master") && c.puremaster == 0) { int i = 0; c.getPA().addSkillXP((15000000), 0); c.getPA().addSkillXP((15000000), 2); c.getPA().addSkillXP((15000000), 3); c.getPA().addSkillXP((15000000), 4); c.getPA().addSkillXP((15000000), 6); c.playerXP[3] = c.getPA().getXPForLevel(99)+5; c.playerLevel[3] = c.getPA().getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[3]); c.getPA().refreshSkill(3); c.puremaster = 1; }

c.getPA().addSkillXP((15000000), Skill Number you want affect);

Right now that will give everyone 99 atk , str , range , hp , mage.

Edit * Rename Master to Max if you want

Read full topic

item.title: How to add the command ::max for players?
item.dc:creator: @Demo1 Demo_
item.description:
@Demo1 wrote:

if (playerCommand.startsWith("max") && c.puremaster == 0) { int i = 0; c.getPA().addSkillXP((15000000), 0); c.getPA().addSkillXP((15000000), 1); c.getPA().addSkillXP((15000000), 2); c.getPA().addSkillXP((15000000), 3); c.getPA().addSkillXP((15000000), 4); c.getPA().addSkillXP((15000000), 5); c.getPA().addSkillXP((15000000), 6); c.playerXP[3] = c.getPA().getXPForLevel(99)+5; c.playerLevel[3] = c.getPA().getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[3]); c.getPA().refreshSkill(3); c.puremaster = 1; }

Try that.
